website_summaries.verdict: A simple and basic teapot that boils water fast. Looks attractive thanks to stainless steel outside. Has nice loud whistle to let you know when water is ready, but not too loud.
pros: No seams, all in one piece makes it easy to clean
Has good grip that stays cool on hands and rotating handle
Good-size opening for filling and cleaning
cons: May spurt water, and sometimes handle gets too warm
Inside material of kettle could be questionable

website_summaries.verdict: Designed for comfort and safety, this quick-heating kettle is attractive and easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: There's like one thing a kettle shouldn't do and this one ...
customer_reviews.text: well, rust is showing up. Just over a month old. There's rust. There's like one thing a kettle shouldn't do and this one did it in record time. Can't trust anyone out here. Should have listened to my mother. Dang.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Good solid kettle, but it rusts
customer_reviews.text: I like it overall: size, shape, simplicity. Handle is comfortable and doesn't get hot. Whistles when boiling as it should. Major drawback is that it rusts (see photos). The lid inside and the area on the kettle adjacent to lid accumulated quite a bit of rust in 6 months. I'm not sure why, as I had several stovetop kettles before and none of them rusted like that (even the cheap chinese noname kettle I had for a while). Maybe it has something to do with the design, because the lid leaves scratches in the kettle body when removed or placed back.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai Pankeev

customer_reviews.title: Interior is not brushed stainless steel....
customer_reviews.text: The product description really should mention that the interior is not brushed stainless steel. It is hard to tell if the interior surface is some unusual or incompletely milled finish of stainless steel (which I have never before seen in any product) or if the interior surface is some other non-stainless-steel material...but the manufacturer should clarify what this interior surface is, to help avoid the churn of ordering and returning incompletely described goods.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Aesthetic, Horrendous Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two months ago, it has been washed every day and we've used steel cleaning products, but there are rust stains all over it. Beautiful shape and was highly rated from an article review, but it's in bad shape after almost no time. The inner lining of the pot has also begun to oddly flake away in rust like spotting.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Whistler doesn't whistle
customer_reviews.text: This may be a random weakness of this tea kettle, since other reviewers were satisfied with whistle -- Mine whistled very softly for a few tries then quit altogether. I was specifically shopping for a whistle, since I cannot stand by waiting to hear a kettle boil--need to hear the whistle in next room. Great disadvantage of buying on Amazon and not from manufacturer --no return policy! I'm hoping to find my old Revere ware kettle from Revere ware, if they are still in business!
customer_reviews.author: Catharine Lucas

customer_reviews.title: OK, this is the 'REAL' & 'REAL' 5++++ STARS review
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally, I turned on the stove highly and left home and came back after 10 hrs. However, this is NOT burnt down (only blacken). Handle, lid, and the front's plastic part is NOT melted and also NO smokes at all. This is first time writing the review in my life and I strongly and posilutely absotively recommend this tea kettle. This kettle saves our neighbors' and my life. Thank you OXO. From now on I am going to use only your kitchenwares.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Great tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle and easy to clean. The whistle is not as loud as I thought it would be but I'm actually glad so it doesn't wake the whole house when I use it. Love it. I have an electric stove and it works just fine; that was a big concern of mine.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysSunshyne

customer_reviews.title: I was very excited about this product but very disappointed in the end
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product approximately 1 month ago. It is already rusting. Also when pouring from the spout, the water splashes and has resulted in burning myself. I was very excited about this product but very disappointed in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Sina

customer_reviews.title: This tea kettle starts making a horrible crackling sound the moment it is put on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This tea kettle starts making a horrible crackling sound the moment it is put on the stove burner. The whistle is high pitched and screechy, and if it is left boiling, water shoots out. I make tea every day, and it is an unfortunate part of my mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: RUSTED AND RUINED BY 6 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: While I was really excited to give this as part of a basket to my husband as a part of my 15th wedding anniversary gift to him, I am beyond dismayed that in less than 6 months, the interior is COVERED with rust. We wash it weekly, leave it open to dry in between uses, and maintain it exactly as directed. I am even MORE dismayed because I bought this based on a review by America's Test Kitchen, which rated it a top buy. I am so beyond angry and disappointed. DO NOT BUT THIS. You will regret it if you do.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Breon

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Do It!
customer_reviews.text: What matters to me is the time it takes the water to boil and the whistle to alert me that it's ready. Performance was just pitiful; pathetic, it took over 30 MINUTES to boil and luckily I was standing right there because the whistle was of poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: I spent a lot of time picking what seemed like the best kettle on amazon
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time picking what seemed like the best kettle on amazon. I specifically wanted a seamless bottom and a full stainless steel construction (at least where the water contacts. This fit the bill perfectly, and I was not disappointed. It even does great for pour-overs, since the spout's shape lends nicely to that. It's not as easy to get a slow consistent flow as with a kettle made for that purpose, but it isn't far off!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: A burn waiting to happen
customer_reviews.text: A very dangerous teapot...The top grip is not covered properly so you can easily burn your hand and the spout lid does not open without manual intervention when pouring... ouch!!
customer_reviews.author: roconnor99

customer_reviews.title: Best Teapot we have had over last 30 years
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has the increased capacity over most tea pots we’ve purchased in the past. It’s much more sturdy and heavy duty than typical tea pots. Easy to clean and looks good. We had the advantage of seeing & using our daughters several times during visits and had been impressed with its performance, looks and construction. We have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews other people had written where they talked about some mysterious coating or something that came loose when this kettle was used, but that didn't happen to me. I tested it by filling it to its maximum fill point with distilled water, bringing it to a boil, and pouring the water into a white ceramic casserole dish. Any floating material would immediately be obvious, but I looked very closely and saw nothing. I rubbed the inside of the kettle with a damp paper towel and also got nothing at all. This kettle was given a top rating by America's Test Kitchen / Cook's Illustrated and I see no reason to argue with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, durable but needs to be vented.
customer_reviews.text: Drink a lot of tea so needed a good kettle. Looks good, nice loud whistle but every time I pour the water out after boiling it spurts/blurts out the water, quite dangerous as it is boiling water. Needs to have a vent somewhere like a gas can does to avoid this splash of boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent J. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: SUPER customer support!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this kettle. Capacity is great, handling is fine. The only reason for 4 stars vs 5 is that the whistle is anemic. But, that's where the famous OXO customer support is a factor. I let them know about the whistle, they asked for a short video, then without putting me through any paces (proof of purchase, etc.) they are sending me a new kettle. I'll upgrade this to 5 stars if the whistle on my new kettle is better. **Update: I received a new kettle from OXO & the whistle works perfectly. Love everything about the kettle - looks, efficient heating, and for sure the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mc Kay

customer_reviews.title: I Give It 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give anything 5 stars, but this kettle is perfect for me. It is a high quality stainless, made well-work of art—no plastic to touch the water, no seam at the bottom, wide opening and well-fitting lid. The whistle isn’t terribly loud but it is pleasant. Pours lovely. I’m editing my review after a day to say the whistle certainly is loud enough when the pot is forgotten and gets very hot. Also, best pouring spout ever.
customer_reviews.author: NanaCA

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is super cute right out the box. After using it for the last few weeks it is already stained on the outside. There was some weird stuff going on in the inside as well. I hope I can still return it. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes metallic
customer_reviews.text: Good looking tea kettle. I bought it because it was highly rated by America's Test Kitchen. However, the handle heats up more than it should (I won't let my kids touch it) and the water tastes metallic. I notice the flavor even with coffee. So there's no using water that has been boiled in it for drinking (just hot water) or for making tea. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: K. Axon

customer_reviews.title: Pin holes 17 months old.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tea kettle in August 2018. I loved it for all of 17 months which was yesterday. I woke up and found my flat glass stove was under water due to 2 pin holes in the bottom of the tea kettle. You pay a high price for low quality products. I will never buy another product from XOX. Now I have to buy another tea kettle. I used to have a tea kettle I bought from Walmart, had it for 10 years and still works, guess I have to get it back out. JUNK...
customer_reviews.author: Becca17

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality materials. Very sturdy handle.
customer_reviews.text: This was wife's style choice. I prefer other styles, but it's been awesome since purchase. Very sturdy, with quality materials and finish. It looks good on the stove. We do pamper teapots by drying the lid and inside of pot after use, so we don't expect to see any rust issues. It heats fast and pours nice and clean. Would definitely buy this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Great tea kettle highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really love my oxo tea kettle. It is a bit heavy for me but it is a very good kettle, it looks good on my stove ,even my adult children seem to like it because sometimes it's not where I expect it to be.i wish I had better hearing for the whistle, but my son can hear it in the back bedroom with his door shut.so I would highly recommend the Oxo tea kettle for anyone looking for a good one,the quality is there.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not happy that it started to rust within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Not happy that it started to rust within 2 weeks. Threw it away. BTW Stainless Steel is not supposed to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: can only fit like 2 cups of water in this or it goes over the spout line
customer_reviews.text: can only fit like 2 cups of water in this or it goes over the spout line other than that it is nicely made I just wish that the spout was higher up. We ordered a different kettle and this one is going to get returned.

customer_reviews.title: It's o. k., but the lips around ...
customer_reviews.text: It's o.k., but the lips around the spout and the lid are molded so that it is very difficult to dry. I have to vigorously shake it to get all the water out. It's already starting to rust. It's a much thinner metal than I would prefer and just seems cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: garnetwaters

customer_reviews.title: Works great on woodstoves, too!
customer_reviews.text: My parents bought one of these because it said it was flat bottomed, and that's what they wanted for using on their woodstove. While it's not a perfectly flat bottom, it does work very well on the woodstove, as well as a gas range. I ordered one for my house, and love it. It's been knocked around and dropped multiple times with no ill effects. Very sturdily built, the handle doesn't get hot on the grip, and easy to hold. If something ever happens to this one, I'd buy another in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Turner

customer_reviews.title: Silver particles and silver dust
customer_reviews.text: Cooks Illustrated recommended this tea kettle so I bought it. But, I am not very happy with it. I washed it with soap and warm water several times and boiled water in it several times. There are still small flakes of silver and silver dust in the bottom of the kettle when I empty it and let it dry. I don't want to drink silver particles with my tea. Has this happened to anyone else?
customer_reviews.author: Patty Ann in Anacortes

customer_reviews.title: Almost works
customer_reviews.text: This kettle should be awesome. I love that the handle folds to either side so I can fill it directly with my filtered fridge water dispenser. The issue with this kettle is the problematic spout. When pouring hot water into a cup or tea pot, how water “burps” out of the spout and onto the counter or on my arm and hand (painful and unsafe!). I’ve tried to pour slowly to overcome this issue but haven’t been able to find a way to pour water without getting water everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: AndreaNicole

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but the pour...
customer_reviews.text: I like the design. folding handle, whistle with no part to misplace or more complicated mechanism to fail, and it boils faster than my previous kettle. It also stays cool where it needs to. Cons: The sputtering pouring issue is real, and you have to stay mentally on top of things and not pour towards you, in case some water splashes over you cup. That is a 2-star issue.
customer_reviews.author: MvW

customer_reviews.title: A tea kettle worth the extra price
customer_reviews.text: The OXO Good Grips Classic tea kettle sits on our range as a perfect compliment to our work-a-day kitchen. Its design is practical and spare--almost. Its well proportioned shape is too appealing to call it spare. It is light weight, making optimum use of the strength of its stainless steel body and spout. The handle is comfortable with a durable and cool to the touch handle. The body is one piece--no rolled metal seam. That makes it easy to clean, and eliminates the likely point of failure with other kettles. This kettle is a masterpiece of design, durability and domestic utility.
customer_reviews.author: Tom the Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle
customer_reviews.text: I'm starting to just go for the OXO version of whatever kitchen item I need, because I've come to trust them as a brand, and this kettle upholds that faith. Very solid construction, high capacity, boils quickly, whistle is quite loud but not deafening, and contrary to what some reviewers have mentioned, I've had no problems with a sloshing pour or the whistle cap's little flip handle becoming too hot. I also like the look of this sitting on my stove, and I expect to get many years of use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pabst

customer_reviews.title: Watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, heavy duty anf functional EXCEPT, having to put your finger so close to the spout to trip the cover is a little disfunctional. It's even worse closing it again. A trigger contraption would make it more functional. One other nice feature, the whistler is loud enough but subdued. Some other kettles are just too shrill!
customer_reviews.author: CLT@PBD

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I got this kettle and I was very excited. When I got it , it was made nice, Stainless steel, firm, it doesn't leak. However, the cover where the water pores out doesn't come up automatically not does it have a bottom or something to push. You have to do it manually, almost every time I burn my fingers if I don't use a cloth or something. That really sucks after the water has been boiling at high temps, that's the last thing you want to do. Its a shame because it looks very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: Mine is dangerously defective -- does not whistle reliably
customer_reviews.text: The kettle itself is mostly nice. The main problem is that the one we got is defective. It does not whistle reliably. A couple of times now, it has been on but we didn't notice because it wasn't whistling. I'm just past the 30 day return/replacement window, so apparently Amazon won't let me replace this. I wish we hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Teapot is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This teapot belches out the hot water and you have to be very careful when pouring. I would not recommend for young ones to use
customer_reviews.author: B Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Oxo Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best stove-top kettle I've ever used. Heats up to boiling pretty fast. I like the rubberized handle grip, and the fact that the handle tilts all the way to the side for filling. Good water capacity too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I find that OXO products are of dependable quality. Not this tea kettle. It is a piece of junk! Looks good in the photos here. I like the handle that moves off to the side for ease of filling. But it is the thinnest stainless steel! It is so light, it feels as if it's aluminum. The rivet attachments are cheap-looking and ugly. I cannot review how it works for heating water, as I'm returning it immediately. Not recommended whatsoever, especially at that cost.
customer_reviews.author: Laura A.

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed whistling kettle
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tea kettle for a little over a week, and so far so good. I drink tea each morning, so I leave the kettle on the stovetop all the time. I wanted something that looked nice. Have always had expensive copper simplex kettles, but I'm nervous about the interior wearing down and I'm sick of polishing the exterior. This was a big leap of faith for me. That being said, there's nothing I don't like about this .... whistle works great and is a high pitched squeal that really gets your attention. Easy to fill and pour. Matches my stainless steel appliances nicely. Just wish they offered a smaller version, but it's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but functions poorly.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This is a very good looking teapot with a serious design flaw. The clip that opens the spout looks safe enough but once you flip it open to pour, it rests against the handle of the tea pot. It is a very snug fit and impossible to close with your fingers, especially when it is hot. The only way to close the spout is to use a towel to protect your hands. The clip design does not allow for easy closure. It forces you to reach under the open, hot clip to close the spout cover The clip is stiff and does not return easily. I've used it several times and am going to request a return.
customer_reviews.author: danica

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Tea Kettle, High quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this Tea Kettle. I bought it in March 13, 2014 for $39.95 + tax and it has become one of the most used items in our kitchen. We use it to make tea and heat water for oatmeal. It warms up the water fast and lets you know it is ready with the whistling sound that is loud enough to hear upstairs but not annoyingly loud (if that makes sense). It washes quickly and I love how you can move the handle to the side to fill it with water. Plus, it is so beautiful, you can leave it out on stove as it adds beauty to your kitchen. I definitely would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Mariposa

customer_reviews.title: big; pours fantastically
customer_reviews.text: This is a very big tea kettle. I wish it were like half its size (I didn't realize when I got it how big it was because the sizing is based on their max fill line, which only comes up halfway in this pot). Functional and pours crazy nicely. I'm keeping it (despite it being 3x the size I want/need) because of how much of a joy it is to pour water out of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: Tea Time
customer_reviews.text: This is a very practical tea kettle. Use it daily. Quick boiling; you can use the whistle feature or not. I've not experienced any issues that some other reviewers have with overfilling/spillage. Obviously, you can't fill it to the top, but if you fill it appropriately, there is well over 4 cups of water. The ergonomic touches do get warm, but you can still handle them. Easy to clean. Solid kettle
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: Very light stainless steel kettle
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. But is shockingly light! I can see the bottom being thinner perhaps to speed up heating but the walls are thin and light too. Almost like aluminum. Done folks may like that. Works ok. Most kettles rust even the more expensive ones. Had a le cruset that rusted on the inside bottom!!! Chipped off. Hopefully this doesn’t rust and fall apart. Amazing that there is not a single kettle in the market that will not rust!
customer_reviews.author: h2plushalfo2

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! II love how large the opening is -- very easy go clean. Only thing that would make this better is a better spout closure. It opens really easily, but you can still tough hot metal when trying to close it if you aren't careful. Often, I leave it open until after it cools. Not my preference, but it's acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: i shopped around and made the right choice.
customer_reviews.text: good solid quality, nice to the touch, pours well. looks great, whistle lid flips up and down easy and as its attached, won't get lost or dropped. nice. oh, and the handle feels good. far from the heat as you hold it, the angle helps you pour with sturdy confidence.
customer_reviews.author: eleanor waterbury

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from bottom...bought another, it leaked too
customer_reviews.text: Leaks from bottom...bought another, it leaked too. After a few uses steam rises up, surrounding kettle. Little drops seep from the bottom seam. I love the kettle otherwise and so discarded the first and ordered a second, at my expense. Same thing. Steam rose from the bottom. I still use it but it has a definite design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect To Me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple whistling tea kettle. I got that and a kettle that I really do like. It has a classic appearance, no frills, but absolutely what I was looking to get. I like that the handle can be moved out of the way when you filling the kettle. Personally, I don't think I could have done better. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchie

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than the more expensive version
customer_reviews.text: We had the "automatic" oxo before, whose spout opened by tipping.. It was frankly a pain in the butt to fill. This one has an insulated lever that keeps the spout open until you need to close it. The whistle on the old one finally melted. I don't think this one will. A better deal, if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: GDawg

customer_reviews.title: Discolors immediately
customer_reviews.text: This kettle discolors immediately after only 1 month of use and cannot be cleaned or discoloration.
customer_reviews.author: AEB

customer_reviews.title: outstanding--best teapot I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Other teapots I've owned have had small, hard to remove lids. The handle would get hot. They'd be hard to pour. Not this one. I was attracted to this teapot when the America's Test Kitchen show recently chose it as their top teapot. After buying, and using it, I'd have to agree. It's exactly what I'd want in a teapot. Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.author: lindapanzo

customer_reviews.title: Smart looking Tea Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Smart looking Tea Kettle and I love the brand. However, you can not fill it up past the bottom of the spout. Tends to spit water when kettle is boiling. When pouring, sometimes spout spits. Overall a good tea kettle if you do not want to make a lot at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Donna R.

customer_reviews.title: It’s whistlin’ !
customer_reviews.text: Lovin it- I use daily to make tea. Heats up quickly and holds heat long enough for my second/third cups. Design is nice and no issues holding the handle when hot (And without a pot holder). Have experienced no rust issues.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tea kettle and works fine
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tea kettle and works fine. Covers fit a little tighter than I'd like, are hard to close. Mostly disappointed that stainless steel is so thin, especially on the bottom. Hoping it doesn't scratch my smooth surface cooktop. Wish they still made quality products like in the "old days!"
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Handle rivets corroded off.
customer_reviews.text: This was great until it failed after 3 years and one month. The rivets holding the handle on corroded off. Quality of the rivets is sub-standard. The kettle would last otherwise IMO.
customer_reviews.author: E W

customer_reviews.title: ITS SO STURDY
customer_reviews.text: It’s been been six months since I bought this kettle, but I must say it’s so good and I like it a lot first and foremost it’s easy to clean I like it’s shape when you walk into my kitchen it’s always sitting on the stove but it’s so sturdy I will surely by another one I Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good kettle
customer_reviews.text: Works good. We use it almost everyday since we bought it. Loud whistler, but you can disable it easily (I like the loudness though). If yours doesn't work try pushing the little small metal piece at the tip of the sprout upward. Mine was dead quiet until I adjusted it. Cap is hard to take off but it's terribly bad. I would give it 4.5 because of the tight cap fit. I rounded down and give it a 4. It is a well designed kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Lam Pham

customer_reviews.title: bad user manual
customer_reviews.text: the user manual says "medium" heat and it doesn't explain what that is. I have 5 NG burners 5k, 9k, 12k, 15k, and 60k BTUs/hour. Above 6k BTU/hr makes the rubberized spout lever to hot to use, but takes a long time to bring to a boil, I just acquired the kettle today, so it is too early to comment on anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient-Geek

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: How this kettle has numerous glowing reviews is incomprehensible! Yes, it's handle is ergonomic and it is stainless steel, so it's easy to clean, BUT those qualities are irrelevant if its spout is so poorly designed as to shoot scalding liquid out of it when you attempt to pour yourself a cup of tea? You cannot control the water flow due to the design of the spout, so as you pour water jets out onto the hand holding the cup you're trying to fill with water. This then causes you to drop it instinctively, causing more scalding spills. Just a really terrible kettle!
customer_reviews.author: consumer for fairness

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Love this OXO kettle! I especially like that the handle can be pushed to the side making filling it so much easier. Not sure why the review asks about heat resistance and warmth. The purpose of the kettle is to boil water!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Is it the chlorine treated tap water that causes tea kettles to rust prematurely or just bad care of the kettle
customer_reviews.text: Used this kettle for one year and a month. Today I purchased a new kettle because on the inside seamless bottom there are what appears to be starting of two rust spots, each appox 1.5cm L x0.1cm W. Small, but an indication of failure or success if price is considered. Tried to find warrenty info and seemed to get the run around. Will check for warrenty when new kettle arrive. Finally, kept distilled water in the kettle at all times, never drained the water from the kettle. However, washed it occasionally with tap water. Is it the chlorine treated tap water that causes tea kettles to rust prematurely or just bad care of the kettle?
customer_reviews.author: Grade = C

customer_reviews.title: Splashless perfect kettle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift. The recipient likes it very much. Does not splash when pouring, very important. Also Its a bit hard to open but I was told they found a way to open it easily so now they have no complaints ! Very easy to clean. Looks great. Whistle can be kept open if you prefer not to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Pannda

customer_reviews.title: This is the best kettle I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: The handle does not get hot, the entire kettle is beautifully made and handsome to look at. if yo need a kettle look no further. I hardly ever write reviews ,but sometimes there are exceptional products out there and this kettle is one of them. Five stars, ten if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Henrietta Gordon

customer_reviews.title: RUST, nasty black residue
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this product. I researched for weeks before pulling the trigger on a new tea kettle. This one had great reviews, and was supposed to be rust-proof. We had used it for TWO days before rust showed up on the lid. Another couple of days and it’s on the bottom of the kettle, along with whatever this black metal looking stuff is, that we certainly shouldn’t be ingesting.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Urfer

customer_reviews.title: looks great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive large tea kettle and the whistle works well. It could be fantastic if made of a little heavier gauge metal and 18/10 stainless versus the 18/8 they used. The base is 7 7/8" and nicely covers large gas range burners.
customer_reviews.author: dos gatos

customer_reviews.title: Not for my glass top electric stove
customer_reviews.text: Received last week. Does not work well on glass top electric stove. Well made, nice design and the handle, whistle, and everything else is perfect. This kettle is best suited for a gas stove. An earlier reviewer said the bottom bows slightly when heated and I believe this is a primary reason why mine does not work well on the flat surface. Also, the wide, flat bottom overlaps the area of the burner by an inch or more which means a part of the bottom all around the kettle rests on the cooler part of the stove. This design works well for gas stoves. So, returning this kettle and hope my next adventure in kettle-assessment produces better results.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B

customer_reviews.title: Parents Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my parents at Xmas time. They love it so far. Do follow some of the precautions to help prevent rust and discoloration found in some of the earlier reviews. The instructions on how high and how much water is too high (the potential issue of water shooting out the spout prematurely) when filling are also important to follow. Follow the use and care recommendations, though, and this kettle should work well for you. My parents really enjoy the side tilt feature on the handle and how quickly the water is heated on their gas stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way  too long to boil and left stain on glass stove top that will not come off.
customer_reviews.text: Alexa Echo recommended this tea kettle for glass top stoves. So I ordered it. Not Good. First of all a FLAT bottom tea kettle is recommended and this one has groves in the bottom. Takes extremely long to boil the water. ( 15:03 minutes before the tea kettle began to boil 32 ounces of water. (which is not much at all when you pour it into the pot) Put the burner on 9 because instructions advised not to put it on high. Now I have a grey stain on my stove top that I have not been able to remove. Takes way too long too boil on a glass top stove. I do like the look of the tea kettle.
customer_reviews.author: ATK

customer_reviews.title: This kettle screams!
customer_reviews.text: Love that the whistle is very very loud! It is sturdy, The handle swings out of the way to fill the pot, and the lever on the pour spout is excellent! I am enjoying this kettle very much.
customer_reviews.author: Musician

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived without any damages/dents. It’s slim and modern looking , it also came with a care instruction. I always liked OXO products and this is a great one again. It does have a weird “off tone” whistle, which makes me chuckle every time, which is a bonus? Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Kettle
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this kettle. It heats enough water for my teapot or French press. It's very easy to dry and clean, so although our water can be hard, the kettle is simple to care for. It works well with my glasstop stove. The whistle is soft, which is not a problem for me, but might be for some. It is also very attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Charlynn

customer_reviews.title: We like this kettle
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid tea drinker and when my old stove top kettle died I did a lot of searching for a new one. After reading the reviews on this kettle I decided to try it out. Love it. Good kettle for the money. We use it almost every day. It has a nice loud whistle, easy to fill, and not clumsy or hard to pour.
customer_reviews.author: Jen4knits

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality testing
customer_reviews.text: I just received this pot a couple days ago and went to heat up some water for my tea and when my wife looked at the pot she noticed a water puddle forming under the burner and called me over to look. After a 2 second look over I noticed where water was slowly leaking out a small pin hole midway between the bottom of the spout and bottom of the pot. I sent it back and am awaiting my replacement unit. This will be the ONLY time I accept a replacement for this product. If it is NOT perfect, this company will hear and feel my disappointment. :/
customer_reviews.author: Darren C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design Solutions for Much Lower Cost
customer_reviews.text: Low and wide kettles will boil water faster but cost much more and require clever technologies to avoid handling problems, such as composite spout seals that will fail in time, remote opening mechanisms, and bi-metal bases. This kettle's taller and tapered design allows for safe handling without cost-increasing features. I maybe wrong; but, I believe it will last longer, too. Let's see. Not 5-Stars because it tends to slosh eruptively if I pour too quickly. Overall, very happy with this economical choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Best Tea Kettle I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I selected it based on the aesthetics but it turns out that performs better than every other one I have owned. Its best features are: the handle moves so you can easily fill it, it has some kind of rubber so that the handle and spout opening do not get too hot, the lid is big enough to make it easy to clean the inside, and it has a larger capacity than most.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor M.

customer_reviews.title: Best yet!
customer_reviews.text: Simple tea pot! Not quite a pretty or fancy looking as some my wife has talked me into in the past, but much better design! Some things are best left simple! It boils water! It whistles! It pours well! It looks good!
customer_reviews.author: Erin P

customer_reviews.title: Worst kettle ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. The bottom of the kettle is the same gauge metal as the sides and top which makes it flimsy. The handle is designed as such to make the pouting awkward. The top is near row which makes the inside nearly impossible to clean. The whistle is so faint that I cannot hear it. But the WORST design flaw is that when I pour the water, the spout is too narrow and the water “hiccups” out of the spout and spews scalding water EVERYWHERE. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Sophie Divenyi

customer_reviews.title: Discoloring
customer_reviews.text: Only had it two months and it's already started to discolor. The handle can get extremely hot and the whistle isn't as loud as my prior kettle except when completely full my expectations were higher.
customer_reviews.author: MyOwnOpinion

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR EVERYDAY USE
customer_reviews.text: I love this tea kettle. I have had it for about 4 months and I use it daily, sometimes multiple times in a day. The hinged handle has a nice silicone grip that stays cool. The whistling spout lid has the same silicone so you can quickly and easily open and close it. The whistle is very efficient! The handle for the lid is some sort of plastic but it does not go through the metal, therefore is never in contact with the water in any way! I might have hesitated buying this tea kettle had I known about the lid handle not being silicone, but honestly after using it I wouldn't trade it in for any other!
customer_reviews.author: Wild Moon Child

customer_reviews.title: Cool Teapot But Handle Gets Hot
customer_reviews.text: This is 2019 and you would think you could get a teapot that you can use the handle without a glove or mitt. Looks nice on the stove, get a lot of use but gotta keep a mitt handy always.
customer_reviews.author: Ja Mata

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Fair warning, the whistle is LOUD. It's a great kettle with good capacity, lightweight and sturdy. You can pick up this kettle off of the burner with the handle and not need a glove. Great design!
customer_reviews.author: running girl

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement item, the handle stays cool, and it heats water quickly and pours without drips. I only wish the spout/whistler were easier to open and it were a little lighter. Overall, very sturdy and perfect size for my needs
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: I like the kettle but be careful when pouring
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice kettle but if you pour it right after it boils the water bubbles out of the spout and you can get burned if not careful. That’s why I took away 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Mensah

customer_reviews.title: Good kettle
customer_reviews.text: The whistle is loud, which I appreciate. The handle doesn't get hot as long as I don't have the flame too high. I haven't had a problem with it boiling over and I'm sure I've filled it up over the fill line many times. The only quirk is that it gives a little "burp" of water at the end of a pour and water will splash beyond the cup. I am able to prevent this by slower pouring. I would definitely recommend this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle, no rust
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this kettle for 9 months with no issue. No problems that others have reported. I’ve never had a problem with the gurgling/splashing even when I put a lot of water in (enough for two mugs or small teapot). ZERO rust. It’s not perfect, but it’s not hard to work around the quirks. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Will Hortman

customer_reviews.title: Lovely teapot - great design, easy to use, loud whistle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to go with our new Oxo Good Grips pour-over coffee brewer. Teapot's wide base heats quickly. Handle doesn't get hot and spout pours well. Brushed Stainless is easy clean and doesn't smudge. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gardenburd

customer_reviews.title: OXO makes great products here's yet another
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is used with my French Press to make the best coffee consistently. The handle is heat resistant, ergonomically perfect when pouring, kettle heats water quickly, and whistles just loud enough. I'm good! Thanks OXO
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Just the most perfect tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: Large but not too large. Lid goes in and stays in. Handle does not get hot and makes it easy to fill. Easy to clean and there is no separate bottom ring to catch grease and gas stove grime. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Meg

customer_reviews.title: Classic look, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love the classic look of this kettle. The handle doesn't get excessively hot either, thanks to the silicon grip. I typically leave the spout up (despite the warnings on the paperwork), but the whistle isn't *overly* obnoxious....just slightly so :) Really love this kettle :)
customer_reviews.author: Munchkin Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great OXO product
customer_reviews.text: I got this recently to replace our old kettle. After using it for a couple of weeks, I haven't encountered any of the water gurgling, handle/spout not staying up, and leaking issues people have talked about in the review section. The kettle is sleek-looking and produces a nice sharp whistle to let you know the water is boiling. It heats the water quickly and water in the kettle stays warm for a long period of time even after the stove's been turned off. I have several items in my kitchen made by OXO and this adds to another great OXO purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ceigna

customer_reviews.title: Superior Product
customer_reviews.text: The reviews of this kettle are mixed, so I wish to report a good experience. This kettle is stylish, has an ample opening for water, and whistles quite loudly when it boils. The handle is heat resistant. It has not rusted in the short time that I have used it. Indeed, I own another OXO tea kettle that is entering its tenth year of service with no rust to be seen. I expect this kettle to be as durable and useful as the one I own now.
customer_reviews.author: M.D. Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Whistle died after 4yrs.  Tea Kettle still alive
customer_reviews.text: This teapot holds a lot of water. The top cover is big which allows for easy cleaning with a sponge and your hand. It pours without leaking or spilling. Hope it lasts. Got it few weeks ago. UPDATE after 4 years: Whistle no longer works. Water boils for too long before I remember to check on it. Don’t know if there is a replacement whistle for it. Because I like this tea kettle so much and there is nothing else wrong with it, I will continue to use it and set my oven timer to remind me to check on it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: handle gets hot
customer_reviews.text: The description says "silicone touch points on spout and handle resist heat" . Maybe emotionally, but not physically. Need to use a hot pad or oven mit or something if you don't want third degree burns..
customer_reviews.author: quadruplethreat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Burn your hand!!!!!  I do not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: While it looks great and works great. For some reason when I go to poor the water out , it poor like napalm. The water shoots out the spout and burn the $W%$@ out of my hand. Also no matter where I place the handle it get too hot to touch. I though I just had to let the whole thing cool down, but my friend came over and burnt themselves and explain I need to get a new pot. I do love the look though.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fox

customer_reviews.title: Nice kettle.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a decent kettle. Does what it’s supposed to do and looks good. Have only had it about a month but it seems to be doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Splendor

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tea kettle...☕️
customer_reviews.text: We love this tea kettle. We use it to heat up water for hot chocolate and oatmeal. The wide open top makes it easy to fill and it whistles loudly when the water is boiling. We definitely recommend this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Initially great, but interior disintegrates
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle initially but the interior lining began to disintegrate creating a milky substance on the water. Even after clean several times you can see a thin film and particles. Not sure why the interior is failing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Tea Pot
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest tea pot I've owned. It's a good weight, looks beautiful, easy to fill and clean, and pours well. The stainless steal will not chip like porcelain ones or rust. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I find the lid is easy to take off and there is plenty of room between handle and lid to do so safely. Clean sleek looking kettle with lots of capacity. Whistle is loud enough for our one story home. Easy to hold and pour. Easy to clean. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Kettle Ever
customer_reviews.text: It's all one piece (except the lid and flip up whistle spout) thus eliminating rusting and leaking. It's been two years and countless "oh crap I left water in it!!" moments yet it's rust and leak free. The handle is firmly riveted in and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Damiano

product_meta.title: OXO BREW Classic Tea Kettle
product_meta.description: Make tea in style with the OXO Classic Kettle, a traditional-shaped whistling tea Kettle. The Kettle features silicone touch points on the spout cap and handle to help resist heat. Flip the spout cap down to cover the spout and listen for the Kettle to whistle when water is boiling. Then flip the spout cap back to reveal a precise spout that won't drip while pouring. Turn the handle down to get it out of the way when filling the Kettle or for storage. A large lid opening makes filling and cleaning more convenient. seamless, high-grade stainless steel guards against rust. Do not place in dishwash
feature_bullets: Silicone handle and spout cap help to resist heat
Large lid opening for convenient filling and cleaning
Loud whistle signals when water is ready
High-grade stainless steel construction guards against rust,Materials : Stainless steel, silicone
